thread.title: Mike Ferner: One candidate, three priorities
thread.title_full: Mike Ferner: One candidate, three priorities

author: 13abc
title: Mike Ferner: One candidate, three priorities
text:
Toledo (13abc, Action News) - "I wouldn't hire a lobbyist or an attorney; we'd get people involved."
Mike Ferner has been around Toledo politics for more than two decades.
Most recently, he led the charge against Promedica's big garage along the Maumee River.
But we chatted with the mayoral candidate outside his home along Lake Erie and found his first priority as mayor is:
CLEANING LAKE ERIE
But he says Toledo needs help.
Mike Ferner says, "We need to clean it up and make sure we have a safe source of drinking water, all the time, not just wondering if it's going to be shut off next summer."
Ferner is an activist experienced in organizing people willing to fight to make a change.
It is that sense of community organization he would use to build a coalition to clean the lake.
But he would also use that skill to tackle his second idea:
FIXING THE STREETS
Ferner would organize communities and petition Columbus to refund tax money owed, which in Toledo's case is $13-million lost.
Money that could fill potholes and pave roads.
Ferner says, "If that means writing letters, taking buses, making phone calls we need to get serious about changing these priorities around because cities are starving right now and we need to get the resources we need."
And in playing to his strength as an organizer, it is no surprise that as mayor he would focus on priority number three:
GETTING CITIZENS INVOLVED IN GOVERNMENT
Ferner insists fixing the city's problems requires an entire community committed to the same goals.
"That is a recipe for a healthy, liveable city," the independent candidate said.
